snippet: Fabiano Caruana won his first seven games at the Sinquefield Cup in St. Louis and wrapped up the title well before the tournament was over.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column observes that Italian grandmaster Fabiano Caruana turned in one of most dominant performances in game’s history at the Sinquefield Cup in St Louis, winning his first seven games and clinching first place long before tournament's end.
lead_paragraph: Fabiano Caruana won his first seven games at the Sinquefield Cup in St. Louis and wrapped up the title well before the tournament was over.

headline.main: Feat of Historic Proportions for an Italian Grandmaster
headline.print_headline: Feat of Historic Proportions for an Italian Grandmaster
